intro: Stachys annua subsp. annua, commonly known as common betony, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring square stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, two-lipped, violet-blue flowers that bloom from June to August. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its medicinal properties have been historically valued for their calming and antispasmodic effects.
